name: Creamy Cajun Deviled Eggs
author: Melissa Dommert
summary: The secret ingredient in these creamy eggs is the cream cheese. 'C'est bon,' meaning 'It's so good!'
ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package cream cheese at room temperature
2 tablespoons creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip®), or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ teaspoon Cajun seasoning, or to taste
directions: Place eggs into a saucepan, cover with cold water, and place over high heat
When water is boiling, cover saucepan with a lid, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 18 minutes
Remove from heat and cool eggs under cold running water until eggs can be handled
Cut eggs in half lengthwise and scoop yolks into a mixing bowl
Beat yolks, cream cheese, creamy salad dressing, pickle relish, hot sauce, salt, and black pepper until mixture is creamy and smooth
Spoon yolk mixture into egg white halves
Sprinkle each deviled egg half lightly with Cajun seasoning
